meanings.definition: A person who rejects consumerism and seeks to reduce waste by salvaging discarded food and other goods.
meanings.sent1: The freegan found a perfectly good chair in the dumpster.
meanings.sent2: She became a freegan to help the environment and live more simply.
meanings.sent3: The freegan joked that their house looked like a museum of discarded treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her freegan lifestyle was a rebellion against the throwaway culture.
meanings.sent5: The freegan's dedication to salvaging items was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: The practice of obtaining food and other goods through salvaging discarded items.
meanings.sent1: Freeganism involves finding value in what others consider trash.
meanings.sent2: They embraced freeganism as a way to reduce waste and live sustainably.
meanings.sent3: The freegan's fridge was always full of rescued food, much to their friends' surprise.
meanings.sent4: In a world of excess, freeganism stands out as a beacon of simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The freegan's commitment to freeganism was unwavering.
